newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: IFP'S FELGATE DEFECTS TO S.AFRICA'S RULING ANC.
newsitem.headline: IFP'S FELGATE DEFECTS TO S.AFRICA'S RULING ANC.

text.p: Walter Felgate, for years an influential hardliner in the Inkatha Freedom Party, said on Thursday he had defected to the African National Congress after disagreements with party leader Chief Mangosuthu Buthelezi.

"I want to be part of the new South Africa, I want to know what it's like to be free," he told a news conference in Durban where he waved around his new party membership card and sported an ANC baseball cap.
Felgate, who is white, was a close advisor to Buthelezi and influential in shaping the Zulu-based party's policies.
The announcement is an embarrassing blow to the IFP which already faces financial troubles and falling support in its power base in the mainly Zulu province of KwaZulu-Natal.
Clashes between supporters of the two parties in the province have killed some 14,000 people since the mid-1980s.
